Detect NHANES-style special missing codes (detection only)

Source: R/nhanes_missingness_summary.R
nhanes_missingness_summary.Rd

NHANES often uses numeric codes like 7, 9, 77, 99, 777, 999 (and similar) to represent special missing values such as "Refused" or "Don't know".

This function:

  • scans each variable for those special codes

  • counts how often they appear

  • reports which codes are present per variable

IMPORTANT:

  • This function does not modify the input data.

  • It is intended as a detection and QC helper.

  • Actual recoding to NA should be done explicitly by the user or in a future, more codebook-aware function.

Usage

nhanes_missingness_summary(
  df,
  special_codes = c(7, 9, 77, 99, 777, 999, 7777, 9999),
  exclude_vars = c("seqn")
)

Arguments

df

A data frame or tibble, typically from read_nhanes_csv().

special_codes

A vector of NHANES-style special codes. Numeric or character.

exclude_vars

A character vector of variable names to exclude from detection (for example, ID variables like "seqn").

Value

A list with:

  • data - the original data frame (unchanged)

  • summary - a tibble with one row per variable, including:

    • variable

    • n_rows

    • n_na

    • prop_na

    • n_special

    • prop_special

    • special_codes_found
